results.title: In memoriam: Harold Holt
results.brief_description: On Sunday December 17th, 1967, Harold Holt, 18th Prime Minister of Australia, disappeared while swimming at Cheviot Beach near his holiday home at Portsea in Victoria. This film shows the memorial service held on December 22nd which was attended by many national leaders including President Johnson of the United States, and Prince Charles representing the Queen. Portrays the mood of a nation mourning the loss of a leader.

results.title: In harbour
results.creator_credit: Joan Boundy, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows the work of the many people who are engaged in working on Sydney Harbour - the fishermen who gain their livelihood from its waters, those who maintain its laws and ensure its cleanliness, those who maintain its equipment and preserve its many miles of wharves and those who dredge its bed and attend to its buoys. They keep the harbour for the ships from many lands to use, but themselves never go “outside”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joan Boundy, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board

They keep the harbour for the ships from many lands to use, but themselves never go “outside”.

results.title: In a manner of speaking
results.creator_credit: Colin Dean and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Illustrates how the telephone can be used to conduct efficient business, and how good habits will improve relations with clients on the telephone. Advice is given on aids to switch-board staff to generally facilitate service to clients. Camera and lighting by Frank Bagnall and George Lowe.

results.title: The Helping hand
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Visatone (Australia)
results.brief_description: Three new-Australians tell of the moment when they felt accepted in Australia and how they have worked to fit in with the local way of living. English lessons at Cooma are shown and finally a naturalization ceremony in a Sydney suburb.

results.title: Heartbeat
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Australian Road Safety Council and Artransa Films
results.brief_description: The heartbeat under normal conditions is shown. A young couple go to an entertainment where there is exciting music and alcohol. Driving away they suffer a fatal accident. The gentleman’s heartbeat is reflected in the tempo of a jazz quartet.

results.title: Heart of a city
results.creator_credit: Ralph W Peterson, Brian Chirlian, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Ajax Films
results.brief_description: Documentary about Queensland’s capital city, Brisbane: the people, cultural events, city and environs. results.title: The Head on collision
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Transport, Telemark Productions and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Made for the Department of Transport, this film shows distractions both inside and outside the car, tiredness, “highway hypnosis”, and alcohol - as the major causes of head-on collisions. Explains how these can be avoided. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Hattie
results.creator_credit: Debby Kingsland, Suzanne Barker, Dept of Social Security and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Social Security”.
Hattie is seventy-six and completely alone, she has lost contact with a of her old friends and interests and feels that her life is now totally empty. Although she has always been happy and active, Hattie says she doesn’t care if she dies tomorrow, and that there are a lot of people like her, discarded because they are old. One of a series of films created originally for day- time television panel discussions to introduce to the public the range of social services available from Government and other agencies.

results.title: The Happy toilers
results.creator_credit: Keith David Smith and Children's Library and Craft Movement
